intro: Bergia capensis, commonly known as the Cape bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the coastal regions of South Africa. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils along the coast, where it thrives in full sun. Bergia capensis has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, clustered flowers that bloom in spring. It is often used in coastal gardens for its ornamental value and ability to withstand salty air.
